content: 'Robert Hooke Building, Parks Road, Oxford OX1 3PR
Label: I

content: 'I am a post-doctoral researcher at the Cyber Security Centre. Currently, I am working on CyberVis, a Dstl funded project, aiming to create a tool to increase situational awareness in CERT environments. My specific research interests lay in business process modeling and optimisation, human computer interaction and in the use and development of formal methods.
Label: I

content: 'Before joining Cybervis, I worked on a research project aiming at developing a system able to reason for and anticipate insider-threat attacks (Corporate Insider Threat Detection: Cyber Security Inside and Out). I have also worked on the TSB and EPSRC funded TEASE project, researching how people understand information quality and provenance, and looking  to develop mechanisms that effectively communicate trustworthiness.
Label: I

content: 'Prior to my post-doctoral experience, I completed a PhD in Engineering at the Warwick Manufacturing Centre (WMG), University of Warwick, focusing on formal methods for information privacy. During my doctoral studies, I worked on the EnCoRe project through which I received an EPSRC studentship. I also hold an MSc in Analysis, Design and Management of Information Systems from the London School of Economics and Political Science in the UK and a BSc in Applied Informatics from the University of Macedonia in Greece.
Label: I
